Plugins Describe
Code Spell Checker The goal of this spell checker is to help catch common spelling errors while keeping the number of false positive low.
Code Time Code Time is an open source plugin that provides programming metrics right in Visual Studio Code.
Indent Rainbow Makes indentation easier to read.
Material Theme The most epic theme now for Visual Studio Code.
Setting Sync Synchronize Settings, Snippets, Themes, File Icons, Launch, Keybindings, Workspaces and Extensions Across Multiple Machines Using GitHub Gist.
TabNine All-language autocompleter â€” TabNine uses machine learning to help you write code faster.
TODO Highlight Highlight TODOs, FIXMEs, and any keywords, annotationsâ€¦
Waka Time Metrics, insights, and time tracking automatically generated from your programming activity.

Iterm

  • æ¨èæŒ‡æ•°ï¼šâ˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…

Change Shell to ZSH

  1. Install homebrew via xcode

    $ xcode-select â€”-install
$ ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"

  2. Install zsh via homebrew and use the home-brew version of zsh

    $ brew install zsh
$ chsh -s /usr/local/bin/zsh

  3. Test if we are using the correct zsh

    $ echo $0
zsh   //correct

$ which zsh
/usr/local/bin/zsh   //correct

  4. Install oh-my-zsh

    $ sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.github.com/robbyrussell/oh-my-zsh/master/tools/install.sh)"

Change Themes and Install Fonts

  1. Install Powerline fonts

    $ git clone https://github.com/powerline/fonts.git
$ cd fonts
$ ./install.sh

  2. Change the Theme to â€œagnosterâ€

    $ open ~/.zshrc
Set ZSH_THEME="agnoster" and save the file

  3. Quit iTerm and reopen it

  4. Add font in Iterm

    iTerm2 â†’ Preferences â†’ Profiles â†’ Text â†’ Change Font

Customise Color Scheme

Install Plugins

  1. Install Syntax Highlighting plugin

    $ git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-~/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting

  2. Install ZSH-AutoSuggestion plugin

    $ git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions $ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions

  3. Edit in zshrc file

    $ open ~/.zshrc

plugins=(
    git
    zsh-syntax-highlighting
    zsh-autosuggestions
    jump
)

  4. Activiate the zshrc file

    source ~/.zshrc

Notes

  1. Add alias in zshrc file

    alias zshconfig="code ~/.zshrc"
alias themeconfig="code ~/.oh-my-zsh/themes/agnoster.zsh-theme"
alias code="open -a 'Visual Studio Code'"

  2. Change terminal title to emoji

    prompt_context() {
  if [[ "$USER" != "$DEFAULT_USER" || -n "$SSH_CLIENT" ]]; then
    prompt_segment black default "ğŸ”¥"
  fi
}

  3. Click here to see zshconfig file.

  4. Click here to see themeconfig file.

  5. Trivial settings
